txt.en: 'I don't go a day without thinking often of those who are hungrier than I. My belly complains often, but at least I have bread to eat, meagre as it is. If only I had bread to spare....'
'I'm so very hungry.'
'Pardon me -- surely...surely you're not giving this to me! Oh, generous [placeholder]! You are too good!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This will consume 1 Yule Festival Token.</rgb>
A Charitable Spirit
'I can smell the food from here....\n\n'It is too bad I cannot afford to have a bite.'
'Gracious me! You are so very kind, [placeholder]. I am amazed by your goodness, my dear [placeholder].'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This will consume 1 Yule Festival Token.</rgb>
Barrett Nowell is moved by your generous gift
'I don't go a day without thinking often of those who are hungrier than I. My belly complains often, but at least I have bread to eat, meagre as it is. If only I had bread to spare....'
'The cold is easier to bear when it numbs you.'
Ted Ives is moved by your gift

'All this, for me? What have I done to deserve such a gesture? I do not know what it is, but I will endeavour to do it again! Thank you, [placeholder].'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This will consume 1 Yule Festival Token.</rgb>
Regina Judson is moved by your generosity

The beggars can be found throughout town, and you can earn Yule Festival Tokens by participating in events at Winter-home.

Inspired by Daley Utteridge's wish to be more charitable with what little he has, you should collect many Yule Festival Tokens to gift to beggars who have nothing.

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This quest will consume 5 Yule Festival Tokens.</rgb>
'Woe, woe. Every day is colder than the next. Every day my poor belly is empty.'
Jack Judson is moved by your kindness
Daley Utteridge is in the workers' area in Winter-home.\n\nYou should return to Daley Utteridge and tell him of your kindness to the beggars. You gave them your hard-earned rewards!

'What charity! What kindess! I haven't been on the receiving end of such generosity in many a long day. I will remember this, good [placeholder].'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This will consume 1 Yule Festival Token.</rgb>
Bill Hyde is moved by your good deed
Donate one Yule Festival Token to Barrett Nowell
Donate one Yule Festival Token to Ted Ives
Donate one Yule Festival Token to Regina Judson
Donate one Yule Festival Token to Jack Judson
Donate one Yule Festival Token to Bill Hyde
Tell Daley Utteridge that he inspired you to give away your hard-earned tokens
'Ho hum. Another day cold and grey. I don't know why I bother to rouse myself every morning.'

'[placeholder]! Did you give the beggars your hard-earned rewards? That was too generous of you -- you worked hard for those!\n\n'How inspiring! I am sure you won't regret such a good deed. Now those unlucky people will be able to eat dinner tonight.'

'[placeholder] has come back to visit! That is enough to brighten my day, for it needs brightening. As I walked to work this morning, I passed the good people of our town who are even worse off than myself. I had nothing to give them. It is the same every morning and every night.

'I count myself very lucky for what I have, but...my life would be better yet if I had the ability to give. All of my wages go to feeding my children and to paying the taxes on our home.

'If only there was something I could do! Perhaps Mayor Goodnough will give us more wages soon, and then I will be able to share my good fortune with the less fortunate.' 

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This quest will consume 5 Yule Festival Tokens.</rgb>

Daley Utteridge has a great deal of good will towards the very poor in Winter-home, but sadly nothing to give. You are moved by his plight.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends. </rgb>
'Can it be? Are...are you giving these to me? I don't know what to say!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This will consume 1 Yule Festival Token.</rgb>
